body:
I have setup 32-bit chroot on 64-bit using instructions from here: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BasicChroot

When I build module with Cython I can see in logs:
```
running build_ext
cythoning cefpython_py27.pyx to cefpython_py27.cpp
building 'cefpython_py27' extension
creating build
creating build/temp.linux-x86_64-2.7
```

There is "x86_64" in the temporary build directory name.

For comparison when running 32-bit Linux with Virtualbox then it shows correct "i686":
```
running build_ext
cythoning cefpython_py27.pyx to cefpython_py27.cpp
building 'cefpython_py27' extension
creating build
creating build/temp.linux-i686-2.7
```

Not sure if this is bug. It's just a display bug, the actual building on 32-bit chroot works fine. Just wondering how the x86_64 got in the temp build directory name.

OS: Ubuntu 14.04 64-bit
Cython: 0.25.2
setuptools 34.3.2
title: When building in 32-bit chroot temp build directory name has "x86_64" in it
